channel.title: Firewall question
channel.description: do you need to have your firewall off to host because i know i did everything right i portfowarded step by step and double checkd everything and activated java is there something i forgot? do i need my firewall off to host?

item.title: Firewall question
item.dc:creator: @HisABlackB0i HisABlackB0i
item.description:
@HisABlackB0i wrote:

You need to allow it into your firewall and if you have a router you need to portforward. Easy stuff if you have a pushover router and a shit firewall.

Read full topic

item.title: Firewall question
item.dc:creator: @F_F_S_Scape F F S Scape
item.description:
@F_F_S_Scape wrote:

Turning your Firewall is unsafe, Altho it does affect some programs you try to run. If you have issues with it try to allow The firewall to ignore that program, Hope i helped.

Read full topic

item.title: Firewall question
item.dc:creator: @Mopar_Is_ze_best Mopar Is ze best
item.description:
@Mopar_Is_ze_best wrote:

You never stated your problem but I’m going to guess that no one can connect to you. I suggest that you try and turn it off because it really doesn’t affect your safety anyways, but go to portforward.com and get the thing that checks if the ports are open.

Read full topic
